Question
========
A mixed factorial design can be defined as a design that:

Answerlist
----------
* has always one between-subjects variable and at least one
  within-subjects variable.
* has at least one between-subjects variable and at least one
  within-subjects variable.
* has at least two within-subjects variables and no between-subjects
  variable
* has at least two between-subjects variables and no within-subjects
  variable

Solution
========





A mixed design has at least one between variable and at least one within
variable. So, there is always at least one between variable and more
than one between variable is also possible.
